dcterms:description: A dynamic resource allocation method based on load balancing and QoS for smart grid fiber-wireless networks, focusing on real-time consumption of underlying network resources and prioritizing virtual network requests.
dcterms:title: Load-Balancing and QoS Based Dynamic Resource Allocation Method for Smart Grid Fiber-Wireless Networks

dcterms:creator: Z. Miao
Y. Wang
Z. Han
dcterms:description: A framework for computation and content resource assignment in wireless virtual networks, focusing on the optimal matching between contents, computation nodes, MVNOs, and users.
dcterms:title: A Supplier-Firm-Buyer Framework for Computation and Content Resource Assignment in Wireless Virtual Networks

dcterms:creator: D. Xu
Q. Li
dcterms:description: A study on cooperative resource allocation in cognitive radio networks with wireless powered primary users, focusing on maximizing the rate of secondary users while minimizing the rate of primary users.
dcterms:title: Cooperative Resource Allocation in Cognitive Radio Networks With Wireless Powered Primary Users

dcterms:creator: S. Lohani
R. A. Loodaricheh
E. Hossain
V. K. Bhargava
dcterms:description: Research on multiuser resource allocation in relay-based wireless-powered uplink cellular networks, focusing on optimizing resource allocation under limited transmission time and energy.

dcterms:creator: L. Tan

F. Ge
N. Xiong
dcterms:description: A comprehensive study on utility maximization resource allocation in wireless networks, presenting various methods and algorithms for efficient resource distribution.
dcterms:title: Utility Maximization Resource Allocation in Wireless Networks: Methods and Algorithms

P. Li
S. Guo
X. Qiu
dcterms:description: A method for virtual resource embedding in fiber-wireless networks, focusing on load balancing and priority to enhance resource allocation efficiency.

dcterms:description: A security-aware virtual network embedding algorithm utilizing reinforcement learning to enhance security in virtual network environments.
